content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.

```julia
function pig_latinify(texts::Vector{String})
    output = Vector{String}(undef, length(texts))
    @threads for (i, text) in enumerate(texts)
        # Algorithm to convert a single string to Pig Latin:
        # 1. Move the first character of the word to the end of the word.
        # 2. Add "ay" to the end of the word.
        chars = collect(text)
        first_char = chars[1]
        pig_latinized = String(drop(chars, 1)...) * first_char * "ay"
        output[i] = pig_latinized
    end
    return output
end
```

This function uses `@threads` macro to run the translation of each string in a separate thread. The `pig_latinify` function takes a vector of strings and returns a vector of the same length containing the corresponding Pig Latin translations.
